description:
The Solar Electrician, Install Lead must abide by all company safety regulations, be adaptable, a good communicator, and comfortable working alone with a team and with homeowners. They need to be familiar with standard electrical rules and guidelines, know how to follow electrical diagrams, maintain vehicle stock and ensure a clean job site.

 

Solar Electrician, Install Lead Responsibilities 

  • Installs and maintains battery storage systems and EV chargers according to engineering designs, permits and electrical code 
  • Completes site assessments, documenting all necessary information to prepare for an installation 
  • Submits service reports immediately following work order completion 
  • Collaborates closely with manufacturers and engineering team to resolve technical issues 
  • Utilizes knowledge, skills, and electrical testing equipment to commission systems and evaluate system issues
  • Identifies solutions to resolve technical design problems, including electrical systems used during construction 
  • Manages vehicle-material stock and equipment inventory
  • Maintains compliance with all company safety policies and practices
  • Provides training to customers about system operation and maintenance
  • Manages and resolves customer concerns and issues in a timely manner; communicates and documents progress to customer and relevant company employees
  • Documents key communications in appropriate company software

 

Minimum Requirements

  • High School Diploma (or GED)
  • 1+ years’ experience as an electrician, solar installer, or solar maintenance technician
  • Current, valid Driver’s license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Report
  • Proficient in speaking, reading and writing English
  • Working knowledge of the NEC

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • OSHA 30 Certified
  • Journeyman Electrical License
  • Formal apprenticeship and/or vocational training 
  • 1 + years’ experience in the solar electric industry preferred.
  • 3+ years’ electrical experience
  • Bilingual, English and Spanish

 

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office 
  • Organized and maintains a professional appearance 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics, and wiring diagrams 

 

Working Conditions

  • Location varies with job site
  • Estimated 10% travel time
  • Driving required; needs valid Driver's license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Record 
  • Must be willing to travel for some projects depending on jobsite

 

Physical Requirements

  • Long hours spent outside on residential rooftops, driving to customer residences, some ground and rooftop work. 
  • Various weather conditions include cold and snowy, hot and humid, and everything in between; must be comfortable working in different environments
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 50lbs; assistance may be provided for oversized items 
  • Must be able to sit, stand, walk, and drive for up to 8 hours at a time 
  • Work postures include reaching, kneeling, pushing, pulling, squatting, crawling, bending, twisting, climbing, and handling objects above/below the shoulder 

 

Benefits

Company offers a generous employee reward package that includes:

  • Comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, healthcare flexible spending account, and 401(k) with employer match.
  • Competitive compensation - $44.50 an hour including overtime
  • Company vehicle provided
  • Corporate card
  • Paid time off, including 10 holidays and Paid Parental Leave
  • Cell phone allowance for many roles
  • Free access to onsite fitness center in Houston and/or discounted fitness memberships through health provider

description:
Our client is looking for a project manager who will have responsibility for successfully navigating large portions of the project development phase for complex utility scale projects. Responsibilities would include oversight of external resources and activities to ensure project success. Project development activities include market analysis, project conceptualization, engineering, site evaluations/acquisition, public relations, environmental/regulatory permitting, infrastructure interfaces, and contract negotiations.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher in engineering, economics, business, or a related field
  • 5 to 10 years of engineering and/or project management experience preferably in developing utility scale infrastructure projects
  • Effectively manage multiple assignments under time constraints
  • Solutions focused team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with a diverse team
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Work independently with direction on a regular basis

Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?"

1914 translation by H. Rackham

"But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?"

Section 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum", written by Cicero in 45 BC

"At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat."

1914 translation by H. Rackham

"On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains."

title: Test Job

description:
This position is responsible for the daily site construction work efforts assigned to you by leadership.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Oversee the daily operations at assigned sites.
  • Maintain daily paperwork required for the site and the crew.
  • Implement and follow through with job instructions provided by leadership.
  • Ensure safety and quality control requirements at your sites and with your crew.
  • Compile all site-specific closeout documentation for your work effort.
  • Upload closeout documentation to customer interfaces.
  • Coordinate with customer representative for site related activities and maintain a good working relationship with customer representative.
  • Provide leadership, guidance and actively train / promote learning to all crew members.
  • Maintain equipment and vehicles in an operational condition at all times.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Skills and Experience

  • At least 5 years of industry experience.
  • Demonstrated expertise in construction skills, rigging, safety and general industry knowledge.
  • Job related certifications
  • First Aid, Safety, Rescue, Wiltron, Anritsu, Fiber, PIM, CPR and Connector attachment
  • Organizational, computer and communication skills.
  • Must be able to read and interpret site plans, RFDS, construction drawings and SOW.
  • Must possess a valid driver's license and comply with company motor vehicle policy.
  • If applicable, the ability to maintain FDOT log books
  • Training will be provided
  • Recognize and provide a safe work site with acceptable quality and efficiency.
  • Ability to lead, teach and train proper work and safety procedures.
  • Must be able to provide, record and manage paperwork (Excel, Word etc)
  • Must be fit and in good physical condition
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be cable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
jd_skills_extracted: operations, site construction, quality control, additional, teach, physical, instructions, read, rigging, safe, manage, industry, construction, compile, weather, coordinate, activities, maintain, pim, license, drawings, actively, leadership, site plans, operational condition, communication skills, CPR
title: Tower Foreman

description:
This position will be working on Renewable Energy projects, and requires travel. The Project Manager is responsible for overseeing projects from planning through completion and ensuring client satisfaction by delivering unparalleled service. Provides overall project management support for several small to medium projects or on one very large project supporting senior project management.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES :

  1. Provide initial client contact to assess scope of work, schedule and resources necessary to successfully complete a project.
  2. Prepare a complete estimate for selected project with a detailed review of plans, specifications and bid form.
  3. Plan and organize a project under the directions of a Senior Project Manager or Division Manager.
  4. Establish project objectives, policies, procedures and performance standards within boundaries of corporate policies.
  5. Supervise the preparation of all change orders on the project. Negotiate all change orders on the project.
  6. Monitor construction activities in conjunction with the onsite Foreman and Area Superintendent to ensure project is being built on schedule, and within budget.
  7. Investigate any potentially serious situations and implement corrective measures within company guidelines, and under supervision.
  8. Supervise the preparation of any and all change quotations for presentation to the prime client. Negotiate all change quotations to a conclusion.
  9. Prepare monthly costing reports under the supervision of a Senior PM or Division Manager.
  10. Manage financial aspects of contracts (progress billing, rental equipment, income/expenses) to protect the company’s interest and simultaneously maintain good relationship with the client.
  11. Review any documentation prepared by Assistant Project Manager before submission.
  12. Represent the company in project meetings.
  13. The duties and responsibilities are intended to describe the general nature and scope of work being performed by this position. This is not a complete listing and other duties may be assigned based on the positions role within the business unit


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering or other related discipline preferred
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in the construction industry in a Project Management role
  • Can be a combination of training, education and relevant work experience


 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES :

  • Ability to understand and follow standard operating policies and procedure
  • Ability to perform duties in a professional manner and appearance
  • Effective performance management skills
  • Extensive knowledge of safety protocols and procedures
  • Proficient in using a computer and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.); Accubid and Oracle preferred
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks, changing priorities as necessary
  • Ability to work under time pressure and adapt to changing requirements with a positive attitude
  • Effective oral and written communication skills as required for the position
  • Ability to be self-motivated, proactive and an effective team player
  • Ability to interact effectively and professionally with all levels of employees, both management and staff alike, vendors, clients, and others


WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • General work environment – sitting for long periods, standing, walking, typing, carrying, pushing, bending. Work is conducted primarily indoors with varying environmental conditions such as fluorescent lighting and air conditioning
  • Noise level is usually low to medium
  • Occasional lifting of up to 50 lbs.

title: Solar/Wind Project Manager

title: TEST 22-8

description:
This position assists in construction, erection and repair of towers and co-location system placement.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Climbing towers and ladders at various heights
  • Erection of various tower types
  • Off-loading material
  • Preparation and cleaning of sites
  • Installation of new carriers on new build and existing towers
  • Instruct and following of Fall Safety procedures
  • Material inventory
  • Capable of leading junior hands while on tower under the direction of foreman
  • Identify and select the proper rigging materials per weight and size of load
  • Perform guy wire change outs, tower modifications and plumb and tension
  • Ability to read a compass, set azimuths and down tilts per specifications
  • Capable of site layout according to prints
  • Serve as a mentor to new less experienced technicians
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

  • High school diploma or GED equivalency
  • A minimum of 4 years tower experience
  • Industrial first aid
  • Ability to read, comprehend and carry out instructions per prints
  • Organized with a strong attention to detail and capable of working with minimum supervision
  • Demonstrated expertise in construction skills, rigging, safety and general industry knowledge.
  • Extensive rigging experience with ability to pass Rigging Course
  • Familiarity with crane signals and gin pole operations
  • Complete installation of lighting systems with the ability to troubleshoot
  • Working knowledge of safety standards and regulations
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Other duties as assigned

No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?"

Section 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum", written by Cicero in 45 BC

"At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Et harum quidem rerum facilis est et expedita distinctio. Nam libero tempore, cum soluta nobis est eligendi optio cumque nihil impedit quo minus id quod maxime placeat facere possimus, omnis voluptas assumenda est, omnis dolor repellendus. Temporibus autem quibusdam et aut officiis debitis aut rerum necessitatibus saepe eveniet ut et voluptates repudiandae sint et molestiae non recusandae. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat."

1914 translation by H. Rackham

"On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains."

title: 3Superitendent

description:
Solar Helper Responsibilities

  • Assists Solar Technician in performing maintenance and service tasks for solar customers in assigned territories
  • Assists Solar Technician in evaluating systems accurately for maintenance, warranty, design, and other purposes
  • Assists Solar Technician in providing Tier 1 troubleshooting for all performing solar systems
  • Develops knowledge of all roof types, the appropriate flashings, and mounts, while working at various heights

Minimum Requirements

  • High School Diploma (or GED)
  • 0-1+ year experience as an electrical technician, solar installer, or solar maintenance technician
  • Current, valid Driver's license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Record
  • Proficient in speaking, reading and writing English
  • Electrical training

Preferred Qualifications

  • OSHA 30 Certified
  • Formal electrical apprenticeship and/or vocational training
  • 0-1 + years’ labor experience in electrical trade, general construction, or mechanical experience
  • 0-1 + years in the Solar Electric Industry
  • Bilingual, English and Spanish

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Organized and maintains a professional appearance
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics, and wiring diagrams

Working Conditions

  • Location varies depending on job site
  • Estimated 10% travel time
  • Able to work an adjusting schedule and respond to emergencies
  • Driving Required; Valid Driver’s License and Motor Vehicle Report required

Physical Requirements

  • Long hours spent outside of residential rooftops, driving to customer residencies, some ground and rooftop work
  • Various weather conditions include cold and snowy, hot and humid, and everything in between; must be comfortable working in different environments
  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds; assistance may be provided for oversized items
  • Able to sit, stand, walk, and drive for up to 8 hours at a time
  • Work postures include reaching, kneeling, pushing, pulling, squatting, crawling, bending, twisting, climbing, and handling objects above/below the shoulder.

description:
A leading professional renewable energy & telecommunications services firm is seeking an experienced Journeyman Electrician for an extensive pipeline of upcoming digital menu board installation projects for a leading global fast food corporation in Miami .This individual will be responsible for electrical wiring, electronic installation, testing, alteration, maintenance of electrical systems.


  • On-site contact providing direction to underground as well as installation and placement of equipment (ie. switch gear, power cabinets and dispensers).
  • Performing a wide variety of duties, which demand a high degree of manual and technical competency to build, assemble and test, inspect, repair, install, modify, and maintain electrical/electronic systems, circuits and equipment.


Duties & Responsibilities:


  • Measures, cuts, bends, threads, assembles and installs electrical conduit using such tools as a hacksaw, pipe threader, rules and conduit benders.
  • Assemble, install, test, and maintain electrical or electronic wiring, equipment, appliances, apparatus, and fixtures, using hand tools and power tools.
  • Interpret and work from electrical drawings, schematics, wiring diagrams, code specifications to determine the layout of industrial electrical equipment installations.
  • Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring and equipment, using standard testing devices such as ohmmeters, voltmeters, and oscilloscopes, as well as observing functions to ensure compatibility and safety of components.
  • Install fixtures, wiring conduits, wire pulls, breakers, fabricate, install and/or run conduit, single/3-Phase work, motor terminations, control and instrument troubleshooting and panel work
  • Inspect electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance with codes.
  • Connect wires to circuit breakers, transformers, or other components.
  • Make layout of electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures, based on job specifications and local codes.
  • Maintain accurate, up-to-date records in accordance with department procedures.
  • Understanding of control systems and how to troubleshoot relays, switches, timers, and solid-state components.
  • Ability to read and understand electrical one-line diagrams.
  • Ability to use hand and power tools.
  • Provides daily project progress to Construction Manager.
  • Assures crew staff are adhering to company safety policy; assists in site clean up.

﻿

Minimum Requirements:


  • 3+ years' experience in the installation, repair and maintenance of electrical systems, equipment and fixtures from blueprints, schematics and sketches or an equivalent combination of relevant education and/or experience.
  • Experience in commercial & industrial electrical work.
  • Field installation experience.
  • General electrician license required.
  • Valid FL driver’s license; Non-negligent driving record.
  • Be able to work late and on weekends when required.
  • Satisfactory results from a background check

description:
The Solar Technician Position 

The Solar Technician's primary responsibility is to support Operations and Maintenance activities by quickly responding to solar system performance maintenance, ensuring optimally performing solar systems, and providing excellent customer service to our customers.

 

The Technician positions fall in a 5-tier structure, based on technical experience, competencies, licensure status, equipment training and competencies, certifications, and defined leadership behaviors. Selected candidate(s) will be eligible for a role in the appropriate tier. 

 

Solar Technician Responsibilities 

  • Utilizes knowledge, skills, and electrical testing equipment to evaluate systems accurately for maintenance, warranty repairs, design, and other purposes; diagnoses and repairs solar and storage systems and electrical components
  • Provides training to service staff on system operation such as how to identify, resolve, and repair issues etc.
  • Completes quality assurance inspections, documents corrective actions, and ensures completion of corrective items within defined timelines 
  • Submits service reports immediately following work order completion 
  • Identifies solutions to resolve technical design problems, including electrical systems used during construction; collaborates closely with manufacturers and engineering team 
  • Develops and uses knowledge of all roof types and the appropriate flashings and mounts to use on those roofs 
  • Manages vehicle material stock and equipment inventory
  • Maintains compliance with all Company Safety policies and practices

 

Customer Service and Dealer Relationships

  • Provides training to customers about service process, system usage, system operation, performance, and maintenance
  • Manages and resolves customer maintenance, service tasks and issues in a timely manner. 
  • Documents progress and other key communications to customers and relevant company employees using appropriate software 
  • Develops positive and professional relationships with dealers, service-only providers, and channel partners within an assigned service area 

 

Minimum Requirements

  • High School Diploma (or GED)
  • 1+ years’ electrical experience 
  • Current, valid Driver’s license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Report
  • Proficient in speaking, reading and writing English
  • Working knowledge of the National Electric Code (NEC)
  • CA Electrical Trainee Card or ability to get one 

Preferred Qualifications

  • OSHA 30 Certified 
  • Formal apprenticeship and/or vocational training experience
  • 1+ years’ experience in the solar electric industry 
  • 3+ years’ electrical experience
  • Bilingual, English and Spanish 

 

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Proficiency using Microsoft Office
  • Organized and maintains a professional appearance
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills 
  • Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics, and wiring diagrams

Working Conditions

  • Location varies depending on job site
  • Estimated 10% travel time
  • Able to work an adjusting schedule and respond to emergencies
  • Driving Required; Valid Driver’s License and Motor Vehicle Report required

 

Physical Requirements

  • Long hours spent outside of residential rooftops, driving to customer residencies, some ground and rooftop work 
  • Various weather conditions include cold and snowy, hot and humid, and everything in between; must be comfortable working in different environments
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds; assistance may be provided for oversized items 
  • Must be able to sit, stand, walk, and drive for up to 8 hours at a time 
  • Work postures include reaching, kneeling, pushing, pulling, squatting, crawling, bending, twisting, climbing, and handling objects above/below the shoulders

description:
If you are looking for a career in a rapidly expanding, growth oriented industry. MasTec Network Solutions has an exciting career opportunity for you! We are a telecommunications services company that offers wireless network operators a variety of services such as Equipment Installation and Commissioning, Microwave Engineering, Civil Construction, Maintenance, and EF& I Services. We also provide structured, in-class and field training services to people interested in a career as a Tower Technician. As a Technician you will assist in the construction, installation, and maintenance of communications tower and support structures. Being a Tower Technician is not for the faint at heart but with MasTec Network Solutions it can be an exciting and challenging career opportunity. Tower Technicians work irregular hours, travel frequently, and work at great heights in extreme weather conditions. At MasTec Network Solutions we recognize our success depends on our exceptional technicians they work hard so opportunities and incentive programs are in place that recognizes top performers for a job well done. If you truly have what it takes to be a great Tower Technician, this is the place to build your career! We are a reputable company that rewards your hard work. We also offer competitive compensation, benefits, and advancement opportunities.

 

As a Tower Technician II, your responsibilities will include:

  • Climbing and working on communications towers for the purpose of installing, replacing, and repairing antenna systems equipment performs tower maintenance under close supervision.
  • The basic use and care of hand tools and mechanical equipment.
  • Knowing the hazards associated with tower climbing, construction equipment, and working on or near energized lines and equipment.
  • The ability to climb tall structures (100 feet or more) with 50 lb. load.
  • Analyzing situations accurately and adopt an appropriate course of action.
  • Communicating orally and in writing.
  • Following instructions accurately and complete assigned course of action.
  • Recognizing safety hazards and performing duties in a safe manner.
  • Work under close supervision.
  • Ability to traveling extensively throughout the assigned territory

 

  • High school diploma or GED equivalency
  • Minimum of 2 years’ tower experience
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours.
  • Individuals must have a valid driver’s license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Industrial first aid
  • Ability to read, comprehend and carry out instructions per prints
  • Organized with a strong attention to detail and capable of working with minimum supervision
  • Working knowledge of safety standards and regulations
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Other duties as required

description:
A leading professional renewable energy services firm is seeking an experienced Apprentice Electrician for an extensive pipeline of upcoming electric vehicle charging station installation projects in Coalinga, California region. This individual will be responsible for electrical wiring, electronic installation, testing, alteration, maintenance and repair of electrical systems and related equipment under the Master Electrician.


  • Works under the direct supervision of Master Electrician performing conduit installation, wire pulls and terminations, assists with equipment placement and anchoring
  • Site based, expected to be qualified to local standards, assisting team in cable terminations and system build, working in single and three phase systems up to 480V, temporary electrical systems and generators


Duties & Responsibilities:


  • Measures, cuts, bends, threads, assembles and installs electrical conduit using such tools as a hacksaw, pipe threader, rules and conduit benders.
  • Inspect electrical systems, equipment and identify hazards.
  • Installation of cable glance.
  • Must have wiring and cable installation by machine, hand and in cable trays.
  • Must be able to troubleshoot.
  • Is responsible for making final electrical connections including Voltages at 480v/3 phase after installation of conduit.
  • Design layout and installation of electrical wiring based on job specification.
  • Observes functioning of installed equipment or system to determine hazards and need for adjustments, relocation or replacement.
  • Ability to read and understand electrical one-line diagrams.
  • Works under direct supervision of Master electrician
  • Assists in site clean up


Minimum Requirements:


  • Minimum of 1-3 years' industrial electrical experience with experience working under the supervision of Journeymen/Master electrician
  • Currently enrolled/working towards journeyman level a plus.
  • Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices and procedures within particular field
  • Works under general supervision
  • Valid CA driver’s license; Non-negligent driving record
  • Be able to work late and on weekends when required
  • Satisfactory results from a background check

description:
The Solar Electrician I’s primary responsibility is to support Operations & Maintenance (O&M) activities by providing quick responses to maintain the performance of the solar systems, delivering excellent customer service to our customers, and ensuring a smooth workflow and optimally performing solar systems. The Electrician uses troubleshooting skills to diagnose and repair solar systems at our customer’s residences, which includes rooftop-work on systems.

The Electrician positions fall in a 5 -Tier structure, based on technical experience/competencies, licensure status, equipment training/competencies, certifications, and defined leadership behaviors. Selected candidate(s) will be eligible for a role in the appropriate tier. 


  

 

Solar Electrician Responsibilities

  • Utilizes knowledge, skills, and electrical testing equipment to evaluate systems accurately for maintenance, warranty repairs, design, and other purposes; diagnoses and repairs solar and storage systems and electrical components
  • Completes quality assurance inspections, documenting corrective actions, and ensuring completion of corrective items within defined timelines 
  • Submits service reports immediately following work order completion 
  • Collaborates closely with manufacturers and engineering team to resolve technical issues
  • Identifies solutions to resolve technical design problems, including electrical systems used during construction
  • Provides training to service staff on system operation such as how to identify, resolve, and repair issues etc.
  • Develops and uses knowledge of all roof types and the appropriate flashings and mounts to use on those roofs 
  • Manages vehicle material stock and equipment inventory
  • Maintains compliance with all company safety policies and practices

Customer Service/Dealer Relationships

  • Provides training to customers about service process, system usage, system operation, performance, and maintenance
  • Manages and resolves customer concerns and issues in a timely manner; communicates and documents progress to customers and relevant company employees
  • Documents key communications in appropriate company software
  • Develops positive and professional relationships with dealers and service-only providers within an assigned service area 

Reports to

  • Field Service Supervisor/Manager

 

Minimum Requirements

 

Experience

  • 0-1+ years’ experience as an electrical technician, solar installer, or solar maintenance technician
  • Sustained insurability to drive as a function of the role 
  • Working knowledge of the NEC

 

Licenses

  • Current, valid Driver's license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Record
  • Current, active electrical license when required by the state, county, or jurisdiction of your residence to perform job responsibilities

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • 3+ years’ electrical experience 
  • Formal apprenticeship and/or vocational training
  • Bilingual- English/Spanish
  • OSHA 30 preferred

 

 

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics, and wiring diagrams
  • Proficiency in MS Office
  • Very strong organizational and communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Able to work an adjusting schedule and respond to emergencies
  • Projects a professional appearance

 

Physical Requirements

  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs, assistance may be provided for oversized items
  • Able to sit, stand, walk, and drive for up to 8 hours at a time
  • Work postures include reaching, kneeling, pushing, pulling, squatting, crawling, bending, twisting, climbing, and handling objects above/below the shoulder

Working Conditions      

  • Working time is spent working outside, working on residential rooftops, driving to customer residences, and some ground and inside work, depending on location of system equipment.
  • In some parts of the country, working conditions may include cold and snowy weather, hot and humid weather, and everything in between. Must be comfortable working in many different environments.
  • Must be willing to travel for some projects; overnight travel estimated up to 25%, depending on jobsite

 

 

Benefits 

Company offers a generous employee reward package that includes:

  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Competitive compensation
  • Company vehicle provided
  • Corporate Card
  • Paid time off, including 10 holidays and Paid Parental Leave
  • Cell phone allowance for many roles
  • Free access to onsite fitness center in Houston and/or discounted fitness memberships through health provider

description:
Our client is seeking a Director O&M, Structural Rehabilitation Engineer with an emphasis on life cycle and rehabilitation work planning. This position is an Executive Level Position and includes oversite of large infrastructure O&M projects as well as support for change management, corporate reporting, and processes and procedures for lump sum estimating.

- Primary responsibilities consist of the management of project pursuits and support of transportation infrastructure projects.

-Project pursuit management includes oversight of and contributions to all aspects of the proposal and estimate development along with review of commercial documents.

-Project support activities include a specific focus on bridge and structure design, construction, and maintenance.

-Routinely reviews bridge design and construction plans to ensure the maintainability of the structure through inclusion of easily maintainable components with the goal of achieving the lowest lifecycle cost.

- Inspects existing bridges and structures to baseline the rate of deterioration of each component and identification of any immediate or short-term maintenance or rehabilitation needs.

- Bridge rehabilitation programs should identify and detail each bridge component with the timing and costs associated with anticipated rehabilitation or replacement.

- Bridge rehabilitation program development requires operations and maintenance knowledge of specific bridge components including bridge decks, superstructure types, protective coatings, barriers and railings, bearings, substructures, slope protections, retaining walls, and associated repair methods

Basic Job Requirements:

- Professional Engineer in Structural Engineering

- 15 years’ experience

- Must have demonstrated life cycle and rehabilitation experience.

description:
Immediate need for a CommSec Engineer with offshore topside engineering experience for a long-term contract role to be based in Southwest Houston.

Ability to work with and manage subcontractor, Perform/review calculations (such as RF and/or WLAN and/or PA coverage, CCTV data traffic analyses) and telecommunication system schematics and wiring diagrams


Job Description


The purpose of this position is to provide the essential administrative processes, technical knowledge, and perform the work listed. This role has the responsibility to promote Fluor’s competitiveness within the global marketplace by delivering quality services of unmatched value and technical competence. This position serves as an Area Lead or Lead on assigned projects or performs moderately complex engineering assignments, evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques to a broad set of complex assignments.


• Apply Cost Competitive Execution techniques to develop the most cost-effective total project solution for execution of the discipline engineering work

• Develop and review specifications, including design criteria

• Participate in activities associated with equipment and material estimating, procurement, permitting, and subcontracting

• Perform and check calculations, specify equipment, and solve moderately complex engineering problems

• Review vendor equipment documentation within the discipline and from other disciplines for compliance with project requirements, and actively seek discrepancy resolution

• Analyze and make independent recommendations regarding solutions to problems with varying complexity in accordance with organization and/or project objectives and guidelines

• Other duties as assigned


Basic Job Requirements

• Accredited four (4) year degree or global equivalent in engineering field of study and eight (8) years of work-related experience; a recognized professional certification or registration in the applicable field, if required; some locations may have additional or different qualifications in order to comply with local requirements

• Ability to communicate effectively with audiences that include but are not limited to management, coworkers, clients, vendors, contractors, and visitors

• Job related technical knowledge necessary to complete the job

• Ability to learn and apply knowledge of applicable local, state/province, and federal/national statutes and guidelines

• Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner


Communications & Security Systems (CommSec)


Responsible for Physical subsystems development as assigned. System include but not limited to:


Security & Surveillance Systems

• Intrusion Detection

• Key Management

• Personnel Access Control

• Security Monitoring System

• Vehicle Access Control

Networking

• Incoming Services

• Local Area Network (LAN)

• Storage Area Network (SAN)

• Wide Area Network (WAN)

• Wireless Local Area Network (WLAN)

Cabling

• Outside Plant Cable (OSP)

• Ship-to-Shore Network Cabling

• Structured Cabling System (SCS)


Telephony

• Hot Line (Security & Process)

• Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) Systems

Miscellaneous Systems

• Emergency Operations / Reaction Control Center

• Entertainment System

• Process Video Monitoring System

• Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) & Battery Systems

• Weather Monitoring System

Site Notification Systems

• Personal Paging System

• Public Announcement General Alarm System

• Wide Area Mass Notification System

Radio Frequency (RF) Systems

• Aeronautical Radio

• Cellular Distributed Antenna System

• Collision Avoidance Radar System

• Emergency Indicating Radio Beacon (EPIRB)

• Microwave

• Navigation Aids (NAVAIDS)

• Ultrahigh Frequency (UHF) Radio

• Very High Frequency (VHF) Marine Radio

• Very Small Aperture Terminal (VSAT)


Other Job Requirements


Due to Client Requirements, Candidates MUST be a US Citizen and DO NOT HOLD dual Citizenship

               

• Works with project personnel to define subsystem scope requirements.

• Works with project personnel to define subsystem business process requirements.

• Assists with development of the Supplier qualification process

• Assists with development of the Supplier selection process

• Develop overall project planning.

• Provide subsystem integration with other project components

• Executes assigned Physical Systems in both the Office and Field.

• Provide system checkout, validation and turnover


Preferred Qualifications

• Professional registration and membership in technical society

• Advanced knowledge of industry codes and standards (ANSI, DHLS, IEEE, NFPA, OSHA, TIA, USNRC)

• Effort-hour estimating and staff forecasting

description:
A leading professional renewable energy services firm is seeking an experienced Construction Manager for an extensive pipeline of upcoming electric vehicle charging station installation projects in Northern California. This individual will be responsible for planning and contracting as well as the up-front office work. The ideal candidate will give continuity between pre construction and field work.


  • Accountable for managing all phases of the construction project(s)
  • Managing and administering construction contracts
  • Ensuring all contractual requirements/special provisions are being met, providing quality assurance for the construction elements installed, and acting as the owner's representative for the successful completion of the assigned electric vehicle project(s)
  • Complete the construction planning efforts, help establish construction protocols and management procedures, and play a critical role in establishing field oversight and inspection teams.
  • Complete the design/development stage and to help lead the program into the construction and commissioning stages


Duties & Responsibilities:


  • Read and familiarize yourself with all Scopes of Work (SOW's) and approved designs and plans
  • Develop detailed project construction budget and project schedule based on aforementioned plans and any constraints - Provide a rolling two-week look ahead schedule
  • Obtain necessary permitting and certifications for project execution
  • Manage all safety documentation required for all construction site activities, including but not limited to - Operator Certifications, Job Hazard Analysis docs, SSSP's, Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS), Methods Of Procedure (MOP's), Lock Out Tag Out (LOTO)
  • Conduct site walks and attend design review meetings
  • Hold and manage weekly construction meetings
  • Conduct bid-walks with General Contractors
  • Conduct pre-construction walks with General Contractors, Landlords and MLA’s
  • Manage general contractors and ensure work is built on time, within budget and per the clients standards
  • Create punch list
  • Take photos daily representing progress of work as directed
  • Inspect the subcontractor work daily for quality control
  • Raise any deficiencies with the site foreman that require remediation
  • Ensure the job site is clean and free of debris
  • Ensure the subcontractors have adequate manpower and equipment on hand to maintain the schedule
  • Leave no doubt that your job is to correct and immediately escalate any non-compliance to safety, quality, and performance
  • Be vigilant - attention to detail shows that you care, that you are professional, and it earns you respect



Minimum Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years (preferably more) of relevant experience as a site superintendent, project or construction manager
  • Experience working directly with sub-contractor’s
  • General contractor
  • Familiarity with major equipment suppliers
  • Ability to read and understand telecom designs and CAD drawings
  • Valid CA driver’s license
  • Non-negligent driving record
  • Be able to work late and on weekends when required
  • Satisfactory results from a background check


Nice to Have:

  • Experience working on multiple electric vehicle projects with intimate knowledge of the erection & assembly of charging stations
  • Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical, Civil, or Electrical), Construction Management, or Business Management

"But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. "On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains."

description:
If you are looking for a career in a rapidly expanding, growth oriented industry. MasTec Network Solutions has an exciting career opportunity for you! We are a telecommunications services company that offers wireless network operators a variety of services such as Equipment Installation and Commissioning, Microwave Engineering, Civil Construction, Maintenance, and EF& I Services. We also provide structured, in-class and field training services to people interested in a career as a Tower Technician. As a Technician you will assist in the construction, installation, and maintenance of communications tower and support structures. Being a Tower Technician is not for the faint at heart but with MasTec Network Solutions it can be an exciting and challenging career opportunity. Tower Technicians work irregular hours, travel frequently, and work at great heights in extreme weather conditions. At MasTec Network Solutions we recognize our success depends on our exceptional technicians they work hard so opportunities and incentive programs are in place that recognizes top performers for a job well done. If you truly have what it takes to be a great Tower Technician, this is the place to build your career! We are a reputable company that rewards your hard work. We also offer competitive compensation, benefits, and advancement opportunities.

 

As a Tower Technician I, your responsibilities will include:

  • Climbing and working on communications towers for the purpose of installing, replacing, and repairing antenna systems equipment performs tower maintenance under close supervision.
  • The basic use and care of hand tools and mechanical equipment.
  • Knowing the hazards associated with tower climbing, construction equipment, and working on or near energized lines and equipment.
  • The ability to climb tall structures (100 feet or more) with 50 lb. load.
  • Analyzing situations accurately and adopt an appropriate course of action.
  • Communicating orally and in writing.
  • Following instructions accurately and complete assigned course of action.
  • Recognizing safety hazards and performing duties in a safe manner.
  • Work under close supervision.

 

  • High school diploma or GED equivalency
  • Minimum of 2 years’ tower experience
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours.
  • Individuals must have a valid driver’s license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Industrial first aid
  • Ability to read, comprehend and carry out instructions per prints
  • Organized with a strong attention to detail and capable of working with minimum supervision
  • Working knowledge of safety standards and regulations


Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Other duties as required

Electrician Apprentice Responsibilities:

1914 translation by H. Rackham

"But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. description:
• Responsible for all technical and safety aspects of PV installations
  • Assist with designing and engineering of small commercial solar electric systems
  • Review designs for compliance with GRID Alternatives design standards and local and national code compliance
  • Train team leader volunteers in solar PV installation
  • Lead installations of solar PV systems with crews of volunteers and/or job trainees
  • Ensure that all solar installations are installed according to GRID Alternatives safety and quality standards
  • Assist in project management for multi-family/small commercial PV installations
  • Assist in warehouse organization, organization of tools and other construction resources, etc.


POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Experience in PV system installation, design, and troubleshooting
  • Experience leading a crew in PV installation
  • Excellent communication skills (ability to work with volunteers and clients, ability to represent GRID Alternatives positively)
  • Flexibility and willingness to embrace change, go the extra mile, and bring ideas and energy to a rapidly growing organization
  • Willingness to work on evenings and weekends
  • Valid Drivers license and clean driving record
  • Willingness to travel extensively throughout the Mid-Atlantic region as well as to other GRID offices around the country


Desired Requirements

  • Passion for sustainability, affordable housing, the environment, or environmental justice, or just generally grounded in making the world a better place
  • Experience in training and/or working with volunteers
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Sketchup or AutoCAD
  • NABCEP certified
  • Electrical license in one or more jurisdictions a plus

title: Solar Installer

description:
This position assists in construction, erection and repair of towers and co-location system placement.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Climbing towers and ladders at various heights
  • Erection of various tower types
  • Off-loading material
  • Preparation and cleaning of sites
  • Installation of new carriers on new build and existing towers
  • Instruct and following of Fall Safety procedures
  • Material inventory
  • Capable of leading junior hands while on tower under the direction of foreman
  • Identify and select the proper rigging materials per weight and size of load
  • Perform guy wire change outs, tower modifications and plumb and tension
  • Ability to read a compass, set azimuths and down tilts per specifications
  • Capable of site layout according to prints
  • Serve as a mentor to new less experienced technicians
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

  • High school diploma or GED equivalency
  • A minimum of 4 years tower experience
  • Industrial first aid
  • Ability to read, comprehend and carry out instructions per prints
  • Organized with a strong attention to detail and capable of working with minimum supervision
  • Demonstrated expertise in construction skills, rigging, safety and general industry knowledge.
  • Extensive rigging experience with ability to pass Rigging Course
  • Familiarity with crane signals and gin pole operations
  • Complete installation of lighting systems with the ability to troubleshoot
  • Working knowledge of safety standards and regulations
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Other duties as assigned

title: Tower Technician III

description:
If you are looking for a career in a rapidly expanding, growth oriented industry. MasTec Network Solutions has an exciting career opportunity for you! We are a telecommunications services company that offers wireless network operators a variety of services such as Equipment Installation and Commissioning, Microwave Engineering, Civil Construction, Maintenance, and EF& I Services. We also provide structured, in-class and field training services to people interested in a career as a Tower Technician. As a Technician you will assist in the construction, installation, and maintenance of communications tower and support structures. Being a Tower Technician is not for the faint at heart but with MasTec Network Solutions it can be an exciting and challenging career opportunity. Tower Technicians work irregular hours, travel frequently, and work at great heights in extreme weather conditions. At MasTec Network Solutions we recognize our success depends on our exceptional technicians they work hard so opportunities and incentive programs are in place that recognizes top performers for a job well done. If you truly have what it takes to be a great Tower Technician, this is the place to build your career! We are a reputable company that rewards your hard work. We also offer competitive compensation, benefits, and advancement opportunities.

 

As a Tower Technician II, your responsibilities will include:

  • Climbing and working on communications towers for the purpose of installing, replacing, and repairing antenna systems equipment performs tower maintenance under close supervision.
  • The basic use and care of hand tools and mechanical equipment.
  • Knowing the hazards associated with tower climbing, construction equipment, and working on or near energized lines and equipment.
  • The ability to climb tall structures (100 feet or more) with 50 lb. load.
  • Analyzing situations accurately and adopt an appropriate course of action.
  • Communicating orally and in writing.
  • Following instructions accurately and complete assigned course of action.
  • Recognizing safety hazards and performing duties in a safe manner.
  • Work under close supervision.
  • Ability to traveling extensively throughout the assigned territory

 

  • High school diploma or GED equivalency
  • Minimum of 2 years’ tower experience
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours.
  • Individuals must have a valid driver’s license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Industrial first aid
  • Ability to read, comprehend and carry out instructions per prints
  • Organized with a strong attention to detail and capable of working with minimum supervision
  • Working knowledge of safety standards and regulations
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be capable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.
  • Other duties as required

description:
The Solar Electrician I’s primary responsibility is to support Operations & Maintenance (O&M) activities by providing quick responses to maintain the performance of the solar systems, delivering excellent customer service to our customers, and ensuring a smooth workflow and optimally performing solar systems. The Electrician uses troubleshooting skills to diagnose and repair solar systems at our customer’s residences, which includes rooftop-work on systems.

The Electrician positions fall in a 5 -Tier structure, based on technical experience/competencies, licensure status, equipment training/competencies, certifications, and defined leadership behaviors. Selected candidate(s) will be eligible for a role in the appropriate tier. 


  

 

Solar Electrician Responsibilities

  • Utilizes knowledge, skills, and electrical testing equipment to evaluate systems accurately for maintenance, warranty repairs, design, and other purposes; diagnoses and repairs solar and storage systems and electrical components
  • Completes quality assurance inspections, documenting corrective actions, and ensuring completion of corrective items within defined timelines 
  • Submits service reports immediately following work order completion 
  • Collaborates closely with manufacturers and engineering team to resolve technical issues
  • Identifies solutions to resolve technical design problems, including electrical systems used during construction
  • Provides training to service staff on system operation such as how to identify, resolve, and repair issues etc.
  • Develops and uses knowledge of all roof types and the appropriate flashings and mounts to use on those roofs 
  • Manages vehicle material stock and equipment inventory
  • Maintains compliance with all company safety policies and practices

Customer Service/Dealer Relationships

  • Provides training to customers about service process, system usage, system operation, performance, and maintenance
  • Manages and resolves customer concerns and issues in a timely manner; communicates and documents progress to customers and relevant company employees
  • Documents key communications in appropriate company software
  • Develops positive and professional relationships with dealers and service-only providers within an assigned service area 

Reports to

  • Field Service Supervisor/Manager

 

Minimum Requirements

 

Experience

  • 0-1+ years’ experience as an electrical technician, solar installer, or solar maintenance technician
  • Sustained insurability to drive as a function of the role 
  • Working knowledge of the NEC

 

Licenses

  • Current, valid Driver's license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Record
  • Current, active electrical license when required by the state, county, or jurisdiction of your residence to perform job responsibilities

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • 3+ years’ electrical experience 
  • Formal apprenticeship and/or vocational training
  • Bilingual- English/Spanish
  • OSHA 30 preferred

 

 

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics, and wiring diagrams
  • Proficiency in MS Office
  • Very strong organizational and communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Able to work an adjusting schedule and respond to emergencies
  • Projects a professional appearance

 

Physical Requirements

  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs, assistance may be provided for oversized items
  • Able to sit, stand, walk, and drive for up to 8 hours at a time
  • Work postures include reaching, kneeling, pushing, pulling, squatting, crawling, bending, twisting, climbing, and handling objects above/below the shoulder

Working Conditions      

  • Working time is spent working outside, working on residential rooftops, driving to customer residences, and some ground and inside work, depending on location of system equipment.
  • In some parts of the country, working conditions may include cold and snowy weather, hot and humid weather, and everything in between. Must be comfortable working in many different environments.
  • Must be willing to travel for some projects; overnight travel estimated up to 25%, depending on jobsite

 

 

Benefits 

Company offers a generous employee reward package that includes:

  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Competitive compensation
  • Company vehicle provided
  • Corporate Card
  • Paid time off, including 10 holidays and Paid Parental Leave
  • Cell phone allowance for many roles
  • Free access to onsite fitness center in Houston and/or discounted fitness memberships through health provider

title: Solar Electrician

description:
This position is responsible for the daily site construction work efforts assigned to you by leadership.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Oversee the daily operations at assigned sites.
  • Maintain daily paperwork required for the site and the crew.
  • Implement and follow through with job instructions provided by leadership.
  • Ensure safety and quality control requirements at your sites and with your crew.
  • Compile all site-specific closeout documentation for your work effort.
  • Upload closeout documentation to customer interfaces.
  • Coordinate with customer representative for site related activities and maintain a good working relationship with customer representative.
  • Provide leadership, guidance and actively train / promote learning to all crew members.
  • Maintain equipment and vehicles in an operational condition at all times.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Skills and Experience

  • At least 5 years of industry experience.
  • Demonstrated expertise in construction skills, rigging, safety and general industry knowledge.
  • Job related certifications
  • First Aid, Safety, Rescue, Wiltron, Anritsu, Fiber, PIM, CPR and Connector attachment
  • Organizational, computer and communication skills.
  • Must be able to read and interpret site plans, RFDS, construction drawings and SOW.
  • Must possess a valid driver's license and comply with company motor vehicle policy.
  • If applicable, the ability to maintain FDOT log books
  • Training will be provided
  • Recognize and provide a safe work site with acceptable quality and efficiency.
  • Ability to lead, teach and train proper work and safety procedures.
  • Must be able to provide, record and manage paperwork (Excel, Word etc)
  • Must be fit and in good physical condition
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be cable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.

title: Solar Electrician

description:
The Solar Electrician, Install Lead must abide by all company safety regulations, be adaptable, a good communicator, and comfortable working alone with a team and with homeowners. They need to be familiar with standard electrical rules and guidelines, know how to follow electrical diagrams, maintain vehicle stock and ensure a clean job site.

 

Solar Electrician, Install Lead Responsibilities 

  • Installs and maintains battery storage systems and EV chargers according to engineering designs, permits and electrical code 
  • Completes site assessments, documenting all necessary information to prepare for an installation 
  • Submits service reports immediately following work order completion 
  • Collaborates closely with manufacturers and engineering team to resolve technical issues 
  • Utilizes knowledge, skills, and electrical testing equipment to commission systems and evaluate system issues
  • Identifies solutions to resolve technical design problems, including electrical systems used during construction 
  • Manages vehicle-material stock and equipment inventory
  • Maintains compliance with all company safety policies and practices
  • Provides training to customers about system operation and maintenance
  • Manages and resolves customer concerns and issues in a timely manner; communicates and documents progress to customer and relevant company employees
  • Documents key communications in appropriate company software

 

Minimum Requirements

  • High School Diploma (or GED)
  • 1+ years’ experience as an electrician, solar installer, or solar maintenance technician
  • Current, valid Driver’s license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Report
  • Proficient in speaking, reading and writing English
  • Working knowledge of the NEC

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • OSHA 30 Certified
  • Journeyman Electrical License
  • Formal apprenticeship and/or vocational training 
  • 1 + years’ experience in the solar electric industry preferred.
  • 3+ years’ electrical experience
  • Bilingual, English and Spanish

 

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office 
  • Organized and maintains a professional appearance 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Reads and interprets blueprints, schematics, and wiring diagrams 

 

Working Conditions

  • Location varies with job site
  • Estimated 10% travel time
  • Driving required; needs valid Driver's license with acceptable Motor Vehicle Record 
  • Must be willing to travel for some projects depending on jobsite

 

Physical Requirements

  • Long hours spent outside on residential rooftops, driving to customer residences, some ground and rooftop work. 
  • Various weather conditions include cold and snowy, hot and humid, and everything in between; must be comfortable working in different environments
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 50lbs; assistance may be provided for oversized items 
  • Must be able to sit, stand, walk, and drive for up to 8 hours at a time 
  • Work postures include reaching, kneeling, pushing, pulling, squatting, crawling, bending, twisting, climbing, and handling objects above/below the shoulder 

 

Benefits

Company offers a generous employee reward package that includes:

  • Comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, healthcare flexible spending account, and 401(k) with employer match.
  • Competitive compensation - $44.50 an hour including overtime
  • Company vehicle provided
  • Corporate card
  • Paid time off, including 10 holidays and Paid Parental Leave
  • Cell phone allowance for many roles
  • Free access to onsite fitness center in Houston and/or discounted fitness memberships through health provider
title: Solar Electrician, Install Lead

description:
This position is responsible for the daily site construction work efforts assigned to you by leadership.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Oversee the daily operations at assigned sites.
  • Maintain daily paperwork required for the site and the crew.
  • Implement and follow through with job instructions provided by leadership.
  • Ensure safety and quality control requirements at your sites and with your crew.
  • Compile all site-specific closeout documentation for your work effort.
  • Upload closeout documentation to customer interfaces.
  • Coordinate with customer representative for site related activities and maintain a good working relationship with customer representative.
  • Provide leadership, guidance and actively train / promote learning to all crew members.
  • Maintain equipment and vehicles in an operational condition at all times.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Skills and Experience

  • At least 5 years of industry experience.
  • Demonstrated expertise in construction skills, rigging, safety and general industry knowledge.
  • Job related certifications
  • First Aid, Safety, Rescue, Wiltron, Anritsu, Fiber, PIM, CPR and Connector attachment
  • Organizational, computer and communication skills.
  • Must be able to read and interpret site plans, RFDS, construction drawings and SOW.
  • Must possess a valid driver's license and comply with company motor vehicle policy.
  • If applicable, the ability to maintain FDOT log books
  • Training will be provided
  • Recognize and provide a safe work site with acceptable quality and efficiency.
  • Ability to lead, teach and train proper work and safety procedures.
  • Must be able to provide, record and manage paperwork (Excel, Word etc)
  • Must be fit and in good physical condition
  • Must have the ability to climb towers, be able to pick up 50 lbs., and be cable of working up to 12 hours on occasion.

Additional Information

  • Individuals must have a valid driver's license and driving record meeting the company policy conditions.
  • Must be available to work weekends and/or nights, in extreme weather conditions if necessary, and be willing to travel extensively.
  • Must be able to work out of market or away from home as work demands.

title: Tower Foreman

description:
The Licensed Electrician, Service is part of Tesla’s Energy Field Operations team. As a skilled member of the team, the Licensed Electrician will help lead the maintenance of residential PV solar systems, Solar Roof, battery storage, and EV wall connectors. The ideal candidate will provide electrical expertise that will contribute to the overall success of servicing Tesla’s energy products. All necessary training, tools and equipment will be provided, including a company vehicle for some positions. 



RESPONSIBILITIES 

·         Work with peers and leadership to evaluate job requirements and cost 

·         Diagnose and troubleshoot electrical component and system issues 

·         Lead efforts on safe work practices for the Field Operations team 

·         Deliver exceptional customer service throughout the process by educating customers about the product(s) and offering real-time updates on job status 

·         Document and update job status in the company database 

·         Attend training sessions and weekly team meetings on new products, maintenance methodology and safety 

·         Perform other related duties, as assigned 


REQUIREMENTS 

·         A valid state Journeyman Electrician License 

·         Ability to work in extreme environments (example: hot sun, cold, crawl spaces, etc.) 

·         Position requires working at heights including on rooftops, climbing ladders and stairs 

·         Capable of performing repetitious duties, including lifting, bending and standing for long periods of time 

·         Must meet all OSHA standards for working at heights including: 

·         Ability to climb and utilize equipment on site including various ladders rated for 325lbs. 

·         Must meet OSHA fall protection standards for at height work limited at 310lbs.  

·         Standard 1926.502(d)(16)(v): https://www.osha.gov/lawsregs/regulations/standardnumber/1926/1926.502 

·          Must be able to meet equipment standards for fall protection (harness, anchor, ropes, etc.) with a maximum capacity of 310bs. 

·         Experience using basic hand and power tools 

·         Basic computer skills required 

·         Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills 

·         Must have excellent customer service skills 

·         Excellent attendance is crucial for the team to achieve success 

·         Ability to work well with others in a collaborative team environment 

·         Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements 

·         Ability to safely handle tools and materials such as: ladders, inverters, solar panels, panel boards, batteries, and other similar electrical equipment, lumber, roofing materials, etc 

·         Understanding of NEC codes

·         Candidates must successfully complete and pass MVR background check 

Physical Requirements

 

·         Must be able to work at great heights including on rooftops, climbing ladders, and stairs 

·         Must be able to work in extreme environments (example: hot sun, cold, crawl spaces, attic etc.) 

·         Prolonged periods of repetitious duties including lifting, bending, and standing for long periods 

·         Must be able to lift at least 50 pounds frequently 

·         Must meet all OSHA standards for working at heights including:

·         Ability to climb and utilize equipment on site including various ladders rated for a maximum capacity of 325lbs.

·         Must be able to meet equipment standards for fall protection (harness, anchor, ropes, etc.) with a maximum capacity of 310bs.



Employee Benefits 

As a full time, Tesla employee, you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents. 

·         Kaiser and UnitedHealthcare PPO and HSA plans (including infertility coverage) 

·         3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution 

·         Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage) 

·         Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability 

·         401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits 

·          Employee Assistance Program, Paid Time Off, and Paid Holiday 

·         Back-up childcare and employee discounts
